results.headline: A Boy Lost in the Underworld
results.summary_short: “Stand Clear of the Closing Doors,” set largely in New York City’s subway system, observes the world through the eyes of a boy with autism.

results.headline: An Intellectual and His Lofty Contempt
results.summary_short: “Gore Vidal: United States of Amnesia” is a documentary about the life and times of the stubbornly liberal author.
results.display_title: Gore Vidal: The United States of Amnesia

results.headline: Intellectual Dueling at a Prep School
results.summary_short: “Words and Pictures,” a comedy of ideas couched in the format of a Spencer Tracy-Katharine Hepburn movie, depicts dueling academics at a New England prep school.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Words and Pictures

results.headline: After Prison, a Life on the Ropes
results.summary_short: A young man, fresh out of prison, tries to rebuild his life as a kickboxer but is noticed by a Mob boss who has other plans.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Wolf

results.headline: Anything to Save Their Pensions
results.summary_short: In the comedy “The Love Punch,” a couple worried about their nest egg decide to steal a diamond.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Love Punch

results.headline: An 18th-Century Korea, Swarming With Assassins
results.summary_short: A Korean ruler known as the king of misfortune faces enemies at every turn in “The Fatal Encounter.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Fatal Encounter

results.headline: Misdiagnosis? You’d Be Angry, Too
results.summary_short: In “The Angriest Man in Brooklyn,” Robin Williams plays a lawyer who reappraises his life when told he has 90 minutes left to live.

results.headline: Saving Their Future, in Bell-Bottoms
results.summary_short: In “X-Men: Days of Future Past,” Wolverine is sent back to the 1970s to round up his young colleagues to help prevent an apocalyptic battle a half-century away.

results.headline: Monsters (the Human Kind) Slithering Through East Texas
results.summary_short: In “Cold in July,” Michael C. Hall, Sam Shepard and Don Johnson are unlikely amigos, banding against evil.

results.headline: The Plagiarist’s Love Interest
results.summary_short: In the German romantic comedy “Lila, Lila,” a waiter (Daniel Brühl) finds a manuscript and passes it off as his own to impress a young woman.

results.headline: We Feel Your Vibe
results.summary_short: “Frequencies,” written and directed by Darren Paul Fisher, is a sci-fi film with a surreal twist on real life.

results.headline: ‘Home’ for the Summer, in a Refugee Camp
results.summary_short: In “A World Not Ours,” the director, Mahdi Fleifel, interviews generations of family in the crowded Palestinian refugee camp where he lived before moving to Denmark.

results.headline: When Single Parents Collide on a Safari
results.summary_short: In “Blended,” the third pairing of Adam Sandler and Drew Barrymore, Mr. Sandler once again proclaims himself both über-doofus and ultimate mensch.

results.headline: She’s Just Off the Boat. He’s the Wrong Man.
results.summary_short: “The Immigrant” tells the story of a Polish woman’s arrival in New York in 1921 and the complicated scoundrel who forces her into prostitution.

results.headline: What Lewis and Clark Inspired
results.summary_short: In “The Discoverers,” a history professor takes his children on a family-fraught trip with historical re-enactors.

results.headline: On the Range, With a Conscience
results.summary_short: Kirk Hanna, the focus of the documentary “Hanna Ranch,” appeared in “Fast Food Nation.”

results.headline: Love, Sex, Marriage and Schopenhauer’s Ghost
results.summary_short: “Chinese Puzzle,” the third film in a trilogy, centers on a womanizing Frenchman who follows his ex-wife to New York.

results.headline: A Menace Who Chops Up Bodies and Enjoys a Good Singalong
results.summary_short: The director Greg McLean reminds viewers of a perilous destination for tourists in “Wolf Creek 2,” a sequel.

results.headline: After an Accident, a Test of Forgiveness
results.summary_short: A widowed factory worker ends up working alongside the man who accidentally caused her husband’s death in the Japanese film “Cold Bloom.”

results.headline: Attending Life’s First Breath and Its Last
results.summary_short: The documentary “The American Nurse,” a tribute to the profession, focuses on five who work across life’s spectrum, from labor and delivery to hospice.
